identificationModule.briefTitle: Effects of Upper Extremity Rehabilitation Robot and Transcranial Direct Current Stimulation in Subacute Stroke
identificationModule.officialTitle: Effects of Upper Extremity Rehabilitation Robot and Transcranial Direct Current Stimulation on Reaching Function of Upper Extremity Among Subjects With Subacute Stroke

descriptionModule.briefSummary: Comparison of real transcranial direct current stimulation (tDCS) and sham tDCS combined with robot training for upper extremity rehabilitation.

maskingInfo.maskingDescription: Participant does not know the allocation.

armGroups.label: Robot and tDCS on-line
armGroups.description: Combined transcranial direct current stimulation(tDCS) on-line and upper extremity rehabilitation robot

armGroups.label: Robot and sham tDCS
armGroups.description: Combined sham tDCS and upper extremity rehabilitation robot

interventions.name: Robot and tDCS on-line
interventions.description: Combined transcranial direct current stimulation(tDCS) on-line and upper extremity rehabilitation robot for 5 times a week for 4 weeks
otherNames: Robot used in this study is Armeo spring

interventions.name: Robot and sham tDCS
interventions.description: Combined sham tDCS and upper extremity rehabilitation robot for 5 times a week for 4 weeks
otherNames: Robot used in this study is Armeo spring

primaryOutcomes.measure: Change of kinematic data during scale for the assessment and rating of ataxia
primaryOutcomes.description: kinematic data during scale for the assessment and rating of ataxia using Trakstar (mean velocity, jerk, smoothness)
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Change from baseline at 4 weeks after baseline

secondaryOutcomes.measure: kinematic data during scale for the assessment
secondaryOutcomes.description: kinematic data during scale for the assessment and rating of ataxia using Trakstar (mean velocity, jerk, smoothness)
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: baseline, 2 weeks after baseline, 4 weeks after baseline, 8 weeks after baseline, 12 weeks after baseline

secondaryOutcomes.description: indicator of the level of impairment of upper extremity, with higher scores indicating lower impairment
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: baseline, 2 weeks after baseline, 4 weeks after baseline, 8 weeks after baseline, 12 weeks after baseline

secondaryOutcomes.description: an activity indicator, has 15 items for testing functional ability
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: baseline, 2 weeks after baseline, 4 weeks after baseline, 8 weeks after baseline, 12 weeks after baseline

secondaryOutcomes.description: Assesses the use of the paretic arm and hand during activities of daily living in hemiparetic stroke patients.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: baseline, 2 weeks after baseline, 4 weeks after baseline, 8 weeks after baseline, 12 weeks after baseline

secondaryOutcomes.description: to assess upper extremity performance (coordination, dexterity and functioning) in stroke recovery
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: baseline, 2 weeks after baseline, 4 weeks after baseline, 8 weeks after baseline, 12 weeks after baseline

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Hemiplegic patients secondary to first cerebrovascular accidents
* Onset ≤ 6 months
* Fugl-Meyer Assessment score ≥ 19
* Cognitively intact enough to understand and follow the instructions from the investigator

Exclusion Criteria:

* Severe upper extremity pain that could interfere with rehabilitation therapy
* Neurological disorders other than stroke that can cause motor deficits
* Uncontrolled severe medical conditions.
